sen.j: 家道（かどう）とは、特定の家において代々伝えられてきた技能・芸能のこと。
sen.e: Kado is a skill and performing art which has been in a family for generations.
Kado is a skill and performing art which has been passed down in a specific family for generations.
sen.cmt: 「特定の」を追加「伝えられてきた」を変更
sen.e: Kado is a skill and performing art which has been passed down in a specific family for generations.

sen.j: 本来、「家道」とはその家が治まるためにその構成員が家の中で守るべき道徳や家政、家計の類を指す言葉であった。
sen.e: Originally Kado meant morals, household management and a family budget which should be maintained by the family members in a house to manage the family.

sen.j: 中世以後、技能・芸能を家業とする特定の家の間で、それぞれの家が持つ技能・芸能の世界とその背景に存在する専門性・普遍性・伝承性・権威性などの価値感を「道」に擬えて、家と道（技能・芸能）の関係が説かれるようになった。
sen.e: Since the Medieval Period between the specific families which had skills and performing arts as their family businesses, people preached the relationships between a family and the professional skill or performing art as their "Michi (way)" by comparing each family's world of the skill or performing art and the values of the back grounds like specialty, universality, tradition, authority and others.

sen.j: 家の存続・発展と道の存続・発展は密接につながり合っており、家は道を追求するために存在し、道が家によって保持されるという補完関係にあると考えられてきた。
sen.e: People had been thinking that Keeping up and developing a family and the Michi were connecting closely, so a family existed to pursue the Michi and the Miichi was maintained by the family in the complementary relationship and especially the tradition inherited from generation to generation and the authority to keep the status and presence as the leader of in the field were considered very importantly.

sen.j: その中でも世代を越えて連綿と継承されていく伝承性とその分野における指導的な地位・存在を保持し続ける権威性は特に重んじられた。
sen.e: Especially, the tradition inherited from generation to generation and the authority to keep the status and presence as the leader in the field were considered very important.

sen.j: 従って、個人が単に技能・資質が備わっているだけでは不十分で、実際の血縁関係、もしくは擬似血縁関係で結ばれた重代・譜第（譜代）であることが、道を有する家と認められるためには重要な要件とされていた。
sen.e: Therefore to be recognized as a family with Michi, it was not sufficient that each member had the skill and quality and it was necessary to have been continued from generation to generation in a blood relationship in real or in-law.

Therefore, to be recognized as a family with Michi, it was not sufficient that each member had the skill and quality but it was also necessary for it to have been continued from generation to generation in a blood relationship or by marriage.

sen.j: だが、家を保持継承するためには稽古を積み重ねて各分野における固有の「型」を習得する必要があり、その上で1代に1人もしくは少数にしか伝えられない口伝を伝授される必要があった。
sen.e: But to maintain and inherit such a family it was necessary to practice hard and master the specific "Kata (form)" in the field and moreover the "Kata" was taught orally to one person or only a few people of a generation.
